links.title: Anti-computer tactics - Wikipedia
links.description: Anti-computer tactics are methods used by humans to try to beat computer opponents at various games, especially in board games such as chess and Arimaa. links.title:
Solving the Expression Problem
      
        ‚Äì journal.stuffwithstuff.com
links.description:
I started working on Magpie out of frustration with a lot of the languages I
used. One of the key itches I wanted to scratch is something called the
expression problem. The original formulation of it isn‚Äôt very helpful to
someone not writing a compiler, so I‚Äôll recast it to something that‚Äôs a little
more tangible and relevant to the kind of code you find yourself writing.
